description: Web developers design and create websites. They are responsible for the look and functionality of a site. Web developers may work on the client side (frontend) or server side (backend) of the website.

Data scientists analyze and interpret complex data sets. They use a variety of tools and programming languages to extract insights and patterns from data. Data scientists often work in industries such as finance, healthcare, and technology.

UX/UI designers focus on creating a positive and enjoyable user experience for websites and applications. They are responsible for designing the user interface, ensuring usability, and creating visually appealing designs.
Software engineers design, develop, test, and maintain software applications. They work with programming languages and frameworks to create solutions that meet the needs of users and organizations.
